title: Netherton Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Brian Clift / Lodge Farm Reservoir
images.caption: Lodge Farm Reservoir. View towards The Waterfront at Brierley Hill.

images.title: Brian Clift / Lodge Farm Reservoir Netherton
images.caption: Lodge Farm Reservoir Netherton. Access road on the south side of the reservoir. Road gives access to the Boating Club and one other dwelling.

images.title: Brian Clift / Lodge Farm Reservoir and St. Andrews Church, Netherton
images.caption: Reservoir and St. Andrews Church, Netherton. Taken from the reservoir's southern edge.

images.title: Brian Clift / Dudley No 2 Canal
images.caption: Dudley No 2 Canal. Canalside house near The Highbridge (Sounding Bridge) Highbridge Road, Netherton. In days past it was the job of the tenant of this cottage to maintain the canal levels with a supply of water from the nearby reservoir. The remains of the sluice gates can be seen in the garden.

description: This pretty reservoir is located in Dudley on the edge of the Saltwells Nature Reserve. You can follow easy footpaths around the site which is also known as Lodge Farm Reservoir. The Dudley Watersports Centre can be found here too. Look out for water skiing and sailing on the water as you make your way along the paths. You can extend your walk by heading south into the nature reserve where there's some pleasant woodland sculpture trails. The Dudley Canal also runs alongside the reservoir so you could pick this up to continue your walking.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Dudley Canal Walk can be picked up to the east. Here you can also explore the Victorian Netherton Tunnel. For more walking ideas in the area see the West Midlands Walks page.
